info.title: OPERA Cloud Xchange Interface OXI API
info.description:
APIs to create and manage OPERA Xchange Interface (OXI) configurations for OPERA Cloud Exchange module functionality.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 23.0.0.0.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2022 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

post.description:
API to Create Automatic Transmission Schedules.

OperationId:postAutomaticTransmissionSchedules

parameters.name: automaticTransmissionSchedulesToBeCreated
parameters.description: Request object to create automatic transmission schedules

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

parameters.name: communicationMethodsToBeChanged
parameters.description: Request object for modifying Communication Methods.

200.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

delete.description:
API to Delete Interface Mapping Conversion Codes by Conversion Code Mapping Id.

OperationId:deleteConversionCodeMappings

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to identify a Conversion Code Mapping in OPERA.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
API to Modify Interface Mapping UDF Conversion Codes.

OperationId:putConversionCodesStatus

parameters.name: conversionCodesStatusToBeChanged
parameters.description: Request to change the status of given Conversion Codes.

200.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

post.description:
API to Create Interface Setup configuration.

OperationId:postExternalInterfaceSetups

get.description:
API to Fetch Inbound Messages From External System by Hotel Id, Interface Id.

OperationId:getIntegrationInboundMessages

parameters.name: integrationSystem
parameters.description: Unique OPERA IntegrationSystem used to identify a IntegrationSystem in OPERA.

parameters.name: interfaceId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to identify an Interface in OPERA.

parameters.name: externalHotelCode
parameters.description: Unique External hotel ID used to identify a external Hotel in OPERA.

parameters.name: externalHotelCodes
parameters.description: Unique External hotel IDs used to identify external Hotel in OPERA

parameters.name: messageTypes
parameters.description: Sepcify Message type to restrict results

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The ending value of the date range.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The starting value of the date range.

parameters.name: includeReviewed
parameters.description: If true, messages that are marked as reviewed will also be fetched

parameters.name: fromMessageID
parameters.description: The starting value of the range

parameters.name: toMessageID
parameters.description: The ending value of the range

parameters.name: messageStatus
parameters.description: Specify Integration message reference value to restrict results

parameters.name: messageReference
parameters.description: Specify Integration message reference value to restrict results

parameters.name: errorMessageWildCard
parameters.description: Specify partial or complete error message to restrict results

parameters.name: errorMessageType
parameters.description: This value is only applicable for outbound messages

parameters.name: msgContains
parameters.description: String to search inside a message. User can specify multiple strings separated by comma

parameters.name: anyOneOfTheMsg
parameters.description: If true then results with message that has at least one of the string specified for message contains will be returned.

parameters.name: valuesOnly
parameters.description: If true then passed string will be matched against the node values of the XML message

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

parameters.name: includeErrors
parameters.description: If true then errors and warnings will be fetched for action id and other criteria mentioned

parameters.name: actionId
parameters.description: Action ID for which errors and warnings should be fetched

200.description: Response object for fetch integration outbound messages

get.description:
API to Fetch Automatic Transmission Schedules by Hotel Id.

OperationId:getAutomaticTransmissionSchedules

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to identify a hotel in OPERA.

parameters.name: interfaceList
parameters.description: Interfaces configured for automatic transmission schedules

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: If true, this flag will set the criteria to return Inactive records along with active records.

200.description: Response object for fetch automatic transmission schedules

put.description:
API to Modify Automatic Transmission Schedules by Hotel Id.

OperationId:putAutomaticTransmissionSchedules

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to identify a hotel in OPERA.

parameters.name: automaticTransmissionSchedulesToBeChanged
parameters.description: Request object to change automatic transmission schedules

200.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

get.description:
API to Fetch Interface Mappings UDF Conversion Codes by Hotel Id and Interface Id.

OperationId:getConversionCodes

parameters.name: interfaceId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to find interface in OPERA.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to identify a Hotel in OPERA.

parameters.name: integrationSystem
parameters.description: Represents both OXI and OXI HUB are installed.

parameters.name: conversionCode
parameters.description: Type of Conversion Code or user-defined function (UDF) module name configured in the system.

parameters.name: udfCode
parameters.description: A flag that is true if the conversion code is an user-defined function (UDF) module code.

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: A flag to indicate whether to include inactive Conversion Codes.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: XML Type by which the Conversion Codes should be filtered.

parameters.name: includeUDFCodes
parameters.description: A flag to indicate whether user-defined function (UDF) module names should be included in the results or not.

200.description: Response to fetch Conversion Codes.

get.description:
API to Fetch Accumulated Business Event Messages for External Systems by Hotel Id, Interface Id.

OperationId:getAccumulatedBusinessEvents

parameters.name: interfaceId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to identify an Interface in OPERA.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to identify a Hotel in OPERA.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

parameters.name: modules
parameters.description: Accumulated Business Event Module

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The ending value of the date range.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The starting value of the date range.

parameters.name: primaryKey
parameters.description: Specify primary key identifier to search for

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: State of Accumulated Business Event

parameters.name: integrationSystem
parameters.description: Represents both OXI and OXI HUB are installed.

200.description: Response object for fetch accumulated business events

parameters.name: interfaceId

parameters.name: hotelId

get.description:
API to Fetch Interface Mapping Conversion Codes by Hotel Id, Interface Id and Conversion Code.

OperationId:getConversionCodeMappings

parameters.name: conversionCode
parameters.description: Conversion Code in OPERA.

parameters.name: interfaceId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to identify an Interface in OPERA.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to identify a Hotel in OPERA.

parameters.name: integrationSystem
parameters.description: Represents both OXI and OXI HUB are installed.

parameters.name: udfCode
parameters.description: A flag that is true if the conversion code is an user-defined function (UDF) module code.

parameters.name: mappingValue
parameters.description: This value is used for wild card search on OPERA Code/External code.

parameters.name: searchBy
parameters.description: Search for both OPERA and External mapping value.

parameters.name: includeGlobal
parameters.description: A flag to indicate whether to include Global Mappings or not.

parameters.name: profileType
parameters.description: Profile type by which the user-defined function (UDF) mappings should be filtered.

200.description: Response to fetch Conversion Code Mappings.

get.summary: Retrieves the statistics of Messages for Opera Exchange Interface.
get.description:
API to Fetch OXI Dashboard Tile Statistics (Upload and Download message counts by Success, Fail and Warning Status codes) by Hotel Id and Interface Id.

OperationId:getMessageStatistics

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to find hotel in OPERA.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Supported Exchange Interface report codes.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date of the report.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date of the report.

parameters.name: statCode
parameters.description: Supported Exchange Interface statistical codes.

parameters.name: interfaceId
parameters.description: ID of the Interface Setup

200.description: Response element for Downloaded Messages statistics.

get.summary: Retrieves the statistics of Messages in inbound,outbound and BE queues.
get.description:
API to retrieve message statistics for inbound , outbound and business event queues.

OperationId:getOXIMessageStatistics

parameters.name: queueName
parameters.description: Queue name from which Message statistics has to be fetched.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA internal ID used to find hotel in OPERA.

parameters.name: messageStatus
parameters.description: Supported Message Status.

parameters.name: InterfaceId
parameters.description: InterfaceID for which Message statistics has to be fetched.

parameters.name: enqueueEndDate
parameters.description: The ending value of the time span.

parameters.name: enqueueStartDate
parameters.description: The starting value of the time span.

parameters.name: groupByModuleAndActionType
parameters.description: Attribute that decides whether the results must be grouped additionally by Module and Action type of the messages.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

200.description: Response elements for Messages statistics.

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in

x-hubid.name: x-hubid
x-hubid.description: x-hubid is a logical grouping of multiple properties that allows api consumers to manage data from a group of properties. This x-hubid is a valid list of hub codes configured in OPERA to which the user has access. Rest APIs without hotelId in the operation path can support hub level integration using x-hubid

automaticTransmissionSchedules.description: Collection of automatic transmission schedules that needs to be created.

automaticTransmissionScheduleType.description: Details which uniquely identifies transmission schedule

messageId.description: Unique alpha numeric value which determines exact transmission schedule. Pass null when creating new transmission schedule

hotelId.description: Hotel code for which the automatic transmission schedule is set.

interface.description: Interface configured for the property for which the automatic transmission schedule is set.

module.description: Data model for which automatic transmission schedule is set.

startDate.description: Date from which transmission schedule has to run

inactive.description: Indicates whether automatic transmission is active or not

delta.description: True to modify how the header and grid information sent in the RTAV message.

lastSend.description: Date when last automatic transmission occurred.

automaticTransmissionScheduleModuleTypeT.description: Data modules that are currently supported

frequency.description: How frequently transmission schedule has to run

hourToRun.description: Hour of day that the transmission schedule has to run.

weekDayToRun.description: Days of the week on which the transmission schedule is to run.

dayToRun.description: Day of the month the transmission schedule is to run. Value should be between 1 and 31.

monthToRun.description: Number representing the month of year that the transmission schedule is to run. For example, 1 = January, 2 = February, 12 = December, etc.

interval.description: If frequency type is set to intervals then this value will be used to determine the frequency. For example if value is 18 then transmission will be sent every 18 minutes

automaticTransmissionScheduleFrequencyTy.description: Frequency for transmission such as Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Yearly and Interval settings

daysOfWeekType.description: Allowed values for the days of week type.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

status.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details
errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

communicationMethods.description: Collection of Communication Methods to be changed.

communicationMethodsEditType.description: Contains new values along with associated old values to edit.

communicationMethodEditType.description: Type represents the Communication Mehtod Base Type.

hotelId.description: SID-RESORT for Global Level and HotelId associated with the interface for the Property Level configuration.

communicationFlow.description: Attribute represents the communication flow like UPLOAD,DOWNLOAD.

communicationType.description: Define values for Communication Types. e.g. NO_COMMUNICATION for None, HTTP for HTTP/S.

communicationMethodType.description: Type represents the Communication Method Base Type.

hotelId.description: SID-RESORT for Global Level and HotelId associated with the interface for the Property Level configuration.

communicationFlow.description: Attribute represents the communication flow like UPLOAD,DOWNLOAD.

allowedComTypes.description: Attribute that indicates whether the communication type allowed or not.

displayText.description: Attribute represents Description of Communication Flow

retryInterval.description: Attribute represents Interval in seconds between retries

startTime.description: Attribute represents Upload start time in HH:MI 24 hrs format

noOfDaysToKeep.description: Attribute represents Number of days files to be kept in the backup folder

versionNumber.description: Attribute represents Version Number of the PM System.

communicationMethodNoneType.description: Type represents details of NONE Communication Type

sleepTime.description: Attribute represents the Idle Time(in Minutes)

communicationMethodHTTPSType.description: Type represents the Communication Type Base Details.

userName.description: Attribute represents Username for Types HTTP

password.description: Attribute represents Password for Types HTTP

sleepTime.description: Attribute represents Idle Time(in Minutes) of HTTP,None

timeOut.description: Attribute is used to indentify the TimeOut(in Seconds) of HTTP,None

compressData.description: Attribute that indicates whether data to compressed or not

useClientCertificate.description: Attribute that indicates whether to use client certificate or not

system.description: System Type(Holidex specific) like Dev, UAT, Prod, Stage

useVaultProxy.description: Attribute that indicates whether to use Proxy URL or User configured URL.

allowCompressData.description: Attribute that indicates whether to allow compress data or not.

conversionCodesStatus.description: Collection of Conversion Codes along with the status that should be updated.

integrationSystemType.description: Represents both OXI and OXI HUB are installed.

conversionCodeStatusType.description: A common type contains basic information about Conversion Code.

conversionCode.description: Type of Conversion Code or user-defined function (UDF) module name configured in the system.

uDFCode.description: A flag that is true if the conversion code is an user-defined function (UDF) module code.

activate.description: A flag that indicates whether the Conversion Code should be activated or inactivated.

externalInterfaceSetups.description: Values of the created External Interface Setups.

interfaceSetupType.description: Type represents ID one Interface Setup

hotelId.description: Property for which the Interface Setup is defined.

externalHotelCode.description: Corresponding property in the external system

machine.description: Logical Name of the machine that runs the OXIHUB

messageFormat.description: Type of the message. (XML, TPI, AMF, etc.).

xMLVersions.description: List of all XML Versions defined for the selected Property

interfaceType.description: Type of the interface (UPLOAD, DOWNLOAD, EXPORT, FTCRS, HOLIDEX, etc.,).

externalSystemActivated.description: Indicates if external system is active

systemType.description: System Type of the interface like OXI, OXI-HUB, OG-SPA, OG-GAMING.

batchProcessBE.description: Select for all interfaces that send data from Opera to an external system.

zipData.description: Compress all accumulated Business Events if true.

deltaMode.description: Indicates external system does not send the full message for changes.

deletionIndicator.description: Allows to set indicators for deleting data in the OPERA system from an incoming message. This is applicable only for Delta Interfaces, which indicates that the external system does not always send full data for a change. In this case OXI will leave data that is not sent in the message untouched in OPERA.

keepingIndicator.description: Allows to set indicators for keeping data in the OPERA system from an incoming message.

orsDestination.description: Indicates if interface is ORS destination.

negotiateXmlSchemaVersion.description: Indicates to set all XML Versions to Max version.

setAllToVersion.description: XML Version to be used by all XLM schemas.

interfaceSetupXMLVersionType.description: Type representing one XML Type Version for one Interface Setup

xMLType.description: XML Type for the current record

version.description: Version of the current XML Type

interfaceSystemType.description: Defines values for System Type of the interface

interfaceSetupMessageIndicatorType.description: Type represents indicators for deleting/keeping data in the OPERA system from an incoming message.

messages.description: List of integration inbound messages matching the criteria provided in the request

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

limit.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether all the records are included in the response or not. Absence of the attribute values should be consider as all rows fetched in the response.

integrationInboundMessageType.description: Elements that uniquely identifies inbound message

enqueueTime.description: TimeStamp of enqueue of message in OXI Monitoring tables (Inbound/Outbound).

dequeueTime.description: TimeStamp of dequeue of message from OXI Monitoring tables (Inbound/Outbound).

interface.description: The interface this message was created for

messageType.description: This identifies the kind of message sent (e.g., reservation, profile, rate, block, rate restriction, inventory, and result)

hotelId.description: Property this message was sent from.

reviewed.description: Flag that tells whether the message is marked as reviewed or not

messagePrimayInfo.description: Information that was obtained in a message such as guest last/first name from a reservation message or block code from a block message.

notices.description: List of errors or warnings that occurred

attachmentExists.description: Flag that tells whether the message has attachments or not

retryCount.description: Shows whether the processing of this message was retried and how many times.

externalMessageKey.description: Populated if external message key is available

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

automaticTransmissonSchedules.description: List of automatic transmission schedules that match the criteria specified in request

automaticTransmissionSchedules.description: Collection of automatic transmission schedules that needs to be changed.

conversionCodes.description: List of Conversion Codes that met the given search criteria.

conversionCodeType.description: A common type contains basic information about Conversion Code.

conversionCode.description: Type of Conversion Code or user-defined function (UDF) module name configured in the system.

uDFCode.description: A flag that is true if the conversion code is an user-defined function (UDF) module code.

label.description: Label of the Conversion Code that is displayed in UI.

active.description: A field that distinguishes active and inactive Conversion Codes.

group.description: XML Types for the Conversion Code.

master.description: Information about the master (if any) that the current code depends on.

conversionCodeMasterType.description: A type that holds details of master code, that the conversion code depends on.

code.description: Value of the master code that the conversion code depends on.

businessEvents.description: List of accumulated business events matching the criteria provided in the request

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

limit.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether all the records are included in the response or not. Absence of the attribute values should be consider as all rows fetched in the response.

accumulatedBusinessEventsType.description: List of accumulated business event messages

primaryKey.description: Primary Key identifier assigned to the business event.

createDate.description: Data when the message was created by external systems

interface.description: The interface this message was created for

module.description: Data module of outgoing message. This identifies the kind of message sent (e.g., reservation, profile, rate, block, rate restriction, inventory, and result)

hotelId.description: Property this message was sent from.

conversionCodeMappings.description: Conversion Code Mapping details that should be updated.

conversionCodeMappingType.description: A common type contains basic information about Conversion Code.

conversionCode.description: Type of Conversion Code or user-defined function (UDF) module name configured in the system.

uDFCode.description: A flag that is true if the conversion code is an user-defined function (UDF) module code.

id.description: Conversion Code Detail Sequence Number, that uniquely identifies a mapping.

operaValue.description: OPERA Code value or user-defined function (UDF) field name of the mapping.

externalValue.description: A value in the External System that should be mapped to the corresponding OPERA Value or user-defined function (UDF) field.

operaColumn.description: Name of the OPERA column that is used in the user-defined function (UDF) mapping.

externalFieldName.description: Field name in the external system that is used in the user-defined function (UDF) mapping.

profileType.description: Profile type of the user-defined function (UDF) definition.

operaToExternalDefault.description: When this is true, the External Value of current record is considered to be the default mapping value, where there are more than one mapping for OPERA Value.

externalToOperaDefault.description: When this is true, the OPERA Value of current record is considered to be the default mapping value, where there are more than one mapping for the External System Value.

overrideExternalDefault.description: A flag to indicate whether the current External Value should be considered as default, when there is already a default External Value mapped for the same OPERA Value.

overrideOperaDefault.description: A flag to indicate whether the current OPERA Value should be considered as default, when there is already a default OPERA Value mapped for the same External Value.

active.description: A flag to indicate whether the conversion code mapping is active in the system or not.

iFCCreated.description: A flag to indicate whether this conversion was manually entered or IFC created.

masterValue.description: Master Value for the Conversion Code Mapping (if any), to which the OPERA mapping value corresponds to. For user-defined function (UDF) mapping, this field represents the profile type of a profile UDF definition.

conversionCodeMappingStatus.description: Type containing additional status information after creating or changing mappings.

conversionCodeMappingStatusType.description: A type that holds status after creating/changing a conversion code mapping.

operaDefaultExists.description: A flag that indicates if another Opera Value is marked as External->OPERA default for the same External Value mapping.

externalDefaultExists.description: A flag that indicates if another External Value is marked as OPERA->External default for the same Opera Value mapping.

conversionCodeMappings.description: Conversion Code Mapping details that should be created.

conversionCodeMappingStatus.description: Type containing additional status information after creating or changing mappings.

conversionCodeMappings.description: List of Conversion Code Mappings that met the given search criteria.

messages.description: List of integration outbound messages matching the criteria provided in the request

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

limit.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether all the records are included in the response or not. Absence of the attribute values should be consider as all rows fetched in the response.

integrationOutboundMessageType.description: Elements that uniquely identifies inbound message

enqueueTime.description: TimeStamp of enqueue of message in OXI Monitoring tables (Inbound/Outbound).

dequeueTime.description: TimeStamp of dequeue of message from OXI Monitoring tables (Inbound/Outbound).

interface.description: The interface this message was created for

messageType.description: This identifies the kind of message sent (e.g., reservation, profile, rate, block, rate restriction, inventory, and result)

hotelId.description: Property this message was sent from.

reviewed.description: Flag that tells whether the message is marked as reviewed or not

messagePrimayInfo.description: Information that was obtained in a message such as guest last/first name from a reservation message or block code from a block message.

notices.description: List of errors or warnings that occurred

attachmentExists.description: Flag that tells whether the message has attachments or not

businessEventQueue.description: If this message was triggered by business event then related information will be populated in this element.

updateTime.description: TimeStamp of change in message processing status (PROCESSED/FAILED/RESEND_SUCCESS/REJECT).

resultTime.description: TimeStamp of receival of acknowledgement from external system (RESULT_SUCCESS/RESULT_FAILED).

deliveryTime.description: TimeStamp of receival of http call status intiated by the OXI processor to deliver message to the external system.

pendingBusinessEventType.description: Business event queue status common details

module.description: Module name where the change occurred

externalSystem.description: Name of the external system that the message was created for

actionType.description: Type of action that the outbound message is pertaining to

actionId.description: Action Id number that is automatically assigned to the action when it happened

enquiryDate.description: Date when the business event change occurred

hotelId.description: Hotel Code associated with business event

createdDate.description: Date and time that the change happened

primaryKey.description: Alpha-numeric key to uniquely identify the data applicable to that particular action

consumer.description: Name of the external system that the message was created for and needs to picked up by.

interfaceControlGroups.description: Contains a collection of OXI Parameters/Settings, organized into groups.

interfaceControlGroupType.description: Type to group the different OXI Parameters/Settings.

interfaceControlType.description: Internal settings that can be of a certain valueType.

wildCardMatch.description: A flag which indicate whether a wild card search should be made.

hotelId.description: Each configuration item will come with a HotelCode which will help the configuration to specify what context the update has to be. Eg. _Global,ORS,'CRO', etc.

conversionType.description: Represents whether the value is OXI Parameter or Conversion code default.

subscriptionCountEligible.description: Indicator if the function does not count against the OPERA Control function count limit or not

useGlobal.description: Flag indicating to use global inbound/outbound value for conversion code.

baseApplicationSettingType.description: Internal settings that can be of a certain valueType.

wildCardMatch.description: A flag which indicate whether a wild card search should be made.

hotelId.description: Each configuration item will come with a HotelCode which will help the configuration to specify what context the update has to be. Eg. _Global,ORS,'CRO', etc.

conversionType.description: Represents whether the value is OXI Parameter or Conversion code default.

subscriptionCountEligible.description: Indicator if the function does not count against the OPERA Control function count limit or not

messageStatistics.description: Response element for Downloaded Messages statistics.

statReports.description: Statistical report - each report is determined by the requested report in the service request criteria.

interfaceSetupIDType.description: Type represents ID one Interface Setup

hotelId.description: Property for which the Interface Setup is defined.

exchangeStatType.description: Since the statistical value can be represented in different measure of units, this element will provide a flexible definition for the supported Opera9 statistical units.

unitType.description: Unit of measurement or the actual code that defines the value. Eg. CurrencyCode for the Amount Category.

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

limit.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether all the records are included in the response or not. Absence of the attribute values should be consider as all rows fetched in the response.

messageStatisticsReportType.description: Exchange interface message statistics report type.

lastProcessedDate.description: Last date on which messages are processed for given criteria.

communicationMethods.description: Response which returns list of Communication Methods

externalInterfaceSetups.description: List of External Interface Setups that meet the criteria.
Values of the changed External Interface Setups.

interfaceControls.description: Contains a collection of OXI Parameters/Settings to update.

legacyInterfaceStatusDetails.description: Response object for fetch legacy interface status.

interfacesStatusType.description: Collection which contains Interface ID and its details.

interfaceStatusType.description: Type which holds the details of Interface.

interfaceId.description: Interface ID for which processor will be started.

hotelId.description: Hotel Code which is associated with Interface ID will be processed.

processType.description: Indicates the mode of processing Interface such as NT Service, DBMS Job.For DBMS Job, Database job will be scheduled to process.

processRole.description: Indicates that the Processor performs a role/function such as Upload , Download, Communication. The Interface with Upload role will upload Interface details to the External System and Download Role will download Interface Details from External System.

status.description: Status of the processor such as Stopped,Running,Exited and Disconnected.

command.description: Command to perform a function Such as Start, Stop, Exit, Diagnostic,Restart.

updatedTime.description: Indicates time at which process started.

systemType.description: The System type for which Interface Setups have to be listed like OXI, OXIHub.

exchangeInterfaceStatusType.description: Indicates that Interface process is disconnected.

exchangeProfileMatchRules.description: Collection of Exchange profile match rules to be fetched

exchangeProfileMatchRulesType.description: Type that holds collection of exchange profile match rules.

exchangeProfileMatchRuleType.description: Type that represents a rule to define point criteria and threshold.

threshold.description: Threshold level of Match Point Criteria.

pointCriteria.description: Set of point criteria to define match attributes, points and Active Flag.

interfaceId.description: Interface for which the rules are configured.

hotelId.description: Hotel for which the rules are configured.

profileType.description: The type of profile for which rules are configured.

active.description: The activation flag for the rule by itself.

pointCriteriaType.description: Type that represents Criteria such as match attributes, points and Active Flag to match profiles.

criterionType.description: Type that represents Criteria such as match attributes, points and Active Flag for Profile Match Rule.

points.description: Weighing points for the given match rule.

active.description: The activation flag for the match rule criteria.

matchAttributes.description: Rules defining the Attributes to match profiles (Ex: Passport number or First name, last name, Telephone or Telephone, Address or more) .

matchAttributeTypeType.description: Profiles to match with Alternate Last Name. Alternate Last Name is not for OXI.

listOfValues.description: Collection of List of Value items.

flexfields.description: Flexfields returning list of name value pairs.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 20.

parameterType.description: Name value pair type that will hold generic parameter information. Only use this type when the parameters being passed are too dynamic to be defined.

integrationMessageAttachmentsType.description: This type holds additional details related to inbound messages like XML and External message

extMsg.description: Orignal message from external systems(From the one's that don't create XML)

exchangeProfileMatchRules.description: Collection of Exchange Profile Matching Rules can be created.
Collection of Exchange Profile Matching Rules can be changed.

offset.description: Indicates the index of the next applicable set(page).

limit.description: Indicates number of records the API can return as per the API request limit sent. A maximum of 200 records can be only returned at a time.

count.description: Indicates number of records the API has returned actually as per the API request criteria.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether there are more records available to be returned as per the API request criteria or not.

totalResults.description: Indicates total number of records available that can be returned as per the API request criteria.

tags.name: OperaExchangeContent
tags.description: The OPERA Exchange Content Service offers capability to manage big content using MTOM.

tags.name: OperaExchangeInterfaceConfig
tags.description: The Opera Exchange Interface Configuration module offers capability of managing, and retrieving interface information.

tags.name: OperaExchangeInterfaceStats
tags.description: Opera Exchange Interface Stats provides statistical data of Uploaded and Downloaded messages for OperaExchangeInterface.
